intro: Mattia gymnandra, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Andes, is a striking plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy white or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has broad, waxy leaves that are often used in traditional ceremonies and rituals. Its roots are rich in alkaloids and have been used in Andean medicine for centuries. The botanical features of Mattia gymnandra make it both a culturally significant and ecologically unique species.
